c74object.name: bach.primeser
c74object.description: Returns series of prime numbers, with a minimum, maximum and optional maximum numbers of items.

inlet.description: If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: start, end, maximum number of items (see llll message).

objarg.name: minimum
objarg.description: The minimum value for the series (see llll message). Default is 1.

objarg.name: maximum
objarg.description: The maximum value for the series, which can also be the none symbol (see llll message). Default is none.

objarg.name: max_items
objarg.description: The maximum number of items in the output llll, which can also be the none symbol (see llll message). Default is none.

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang outputs the series of primes according to the most recently received parameters.

method.name: int
method.digest: Set minimum, maximum, maximum number of items
method.description:
In first inlet: the minimum value of the series.
In second inlet; the maximum value of the series.
In third inlet: the maximum number of items.
If the maximum is set to none, no maximum is considered. This is the default. If the maximum number of items is set to none, no maximum number of items is considered. The default is 1000. If both are set to actual values, the stronger requirement between the two is respected. Anyway, even in 64-bit mode no prime number bigger than 2147483647 can be output.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set minimum, maximum, maximum number of items
method.description:
In first inlet: the minimum and maximum values of the series, and the maximum number of items.
In second inlet; the maximum value of the series and the maximum number of items.
In third inlet: the maximum number of items.
If the maximum is set to none, no maximum is considered. This is the default. If the maximum number of items is set to none, no maximum number of items is considered. The default is 1000. If both are set to actual values, the stronger requirement between the two is respected. Anyway, even in 64-bit mode no prime number bigger than 2147483647 can be output.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: Even in 64-bit mode, no prime number bigger than 2147483647 can be output.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (int/llll)
entry.description: Starting value. If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: start, end, maximum number of items (see llll message).

entry.name: More details
entry.description: Even in 64-bit mode, no prime number bigger than 2147483647 can be output.
